key_responsibilities: communications planning and press strategy for D.C. and the district

office: House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis for the Office of Diversity and Inclusion
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators for the Office
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices

serving as the project manager for any consultants and/or contractors with whom the Office may engage to support the completion of the diversity report and to develop relevant diversity and inclusion-based training, in collaboration with the Congressional Staff Academy
assisting in the translation of research findings into materials that staff can effectively utilize in their engagements with Members and Member offices
providing research support on diversity and inclusion studies, techniques and tools
serving as project manager for the diversity report and, where necessary, directing and coordinating activities of external consultants
researching and studying best practices for retention and growth in House employing offices
leading data tracking and reporting with a focus on performance and results
preparing regular updates and briefing documents on research that is relevant to House employing offices
assisting with the development and delivery of training sessions and, as needed, conducting presentations at professional conferences and meetings
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development
current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
customer-service orientation and ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours if needed on assignment
demonstrated ability to self-motivate, initiate project activities, and work on multiple assignments simultaneously
extensive computer skills, including data input

key_responsibilities: managing and maintaining the Member’s daily and long term calendar in D.C.

ensuring the Member is provided with briefing materials for each event and meeting
performing other duties as necessary

arranging travel to/from Washington, DC
general administrative tasks

excellent oral, written and interpersonal skills

working a flexible schedule including long hours, nights and weekends
performing other duties as assigned

key_responsibilities: answering incoming phone calls to log opinions, to connect staffers to outside stakeholders, and to direct callers to appropriate resources

key_responsibilities: managing all aspects of the Member’s daily and long-term schedule in DC

performing other administrative duties as needed

signing for deliveries and forwarding all materials delivered to the office to appropriate staff members in a timely matter

performing other duties as assigned

key_responsibilities: managing and coordinating the messaging and communications activities, including media contacts, for the Member and the office
traditional and digital communications including emails, social media posts, and website updates
acting as the formal spokesperson and media liaison for the Member
developing and implementing media, communications, and public relations strategy for the Member
remaining abreast of current legislative and non-legislative issues about which the Member may speak or be questioned
evaluating current events and media reports in the District and the nation for their impact on the Member
providing ideas and advice on the effect, in the media, of the Member's actions and legislative activities
writing speeches for the Member
meeting attendance requirements as established by the office
maintaining a good working relationship with the Member, staff, media, and constituents
working well under pressure and handling stress
accepting performance-based criticism and direction
working a flexible schedule including long hours, nights, and weekends
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: Bachelor’s degree in journalism, public relations, or a closely related field
at least 5 years of professional media experience
strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
thorough understanding of digital, print, social and broadcast media
thorough knowledge of the legislative process, procedures, and organization of the House
knowledge of current issues and events in which the Member is involved
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member's position on policy issues
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
knowledge of office policies, practices, and procedures
proficiency in Microsoft Word, Power Point, Access, and Excel

key_responsibilities: ensuring that the legislative staff is properly focused on carrying out the Member's legislative goals and works to formulate positions on legislative issues

monitoring legislative activity on the House floor and handling long-term and short-term legislative planning for the Member and overseeing the progression of bills with which the Member is involved as they move from Committee to the floor
recommending strategies and tactics on bills and positions

assigning legislative staff areas of responsibility, monitoring and evaluating the work of legislative staff, training and supervising legislative staff, and ensuring that legislative staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
scheduling and directing legislative staff meetings and meeting with groups of constituents or other office visitors, as necessary

recommending co-sponsorships of legislation to the Member, writing and reviewing legislative memos, and recommending hiring of legislative staff, with approval of the Chief of Staff and the Member, when necessary
overseeing activities of the D.C. office in the absence of the Chief of Staff/Administrative Assistant
maintaining up-to-date status reports on all legislation affecting the District, legislation in which the Member is a principal sponsor, or legislation on which the Member is a cosponsor
monitoring and reporting on Floor action to the Member and the Chief of Staff
coordinating responses to all legislative mail and assisting organizations and constituents in the District with federal matters
maintaining a good working relationship with the Member, staff and constituents and accepting performance-based criticism
working a flexible schedule including long hours, nights, and weekends and meeting attendance requirements as established by the office
working well under pressure and handling stress
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: thorough knowledge of legislative process and of House organization and procedures
thorough knowledge of Members’ Congressional Handbook and House Rules
ability to perform essential job functions above
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
provides necessary organization, supervisory, leadership and motivation to supervise the legislative staff
possesses excellent oral and written communication skills along with knowledge of office policies, practices, and procedures
knowledge of office computer applications including proficiency in Microsoft Word, Power Point, Access, and Excel

strong understanding of the digital media landscape and the latest digital trends
ability to identify opportunities to reach new audiences online
